description: Fungal or bacterial infection forming brown or black spots on leaves, leading to yellowing and premature leaf drop
precaution: Remove infected leaves, avoid excess moisture, improve air circulation, apply fungicides or bactericides if needed

description: Fungal disease causing dark, sunken spots on leaves, leading to leaf drop and reduced plant growth, especially in humid conditions
precaution: Remove and destroy infected leaves, improve air circulation, avoid excess moisture, and apply copper-based fungicides

description: Dark or brown spots appear on pepper plant leaves, often leading to reduced growth and yield, typically caused by fungal or bacterial infections.
precaution: Remove infected leaves, maintain proper spacing, avoid water accumulation, and apply fungicides or bactericides as required.

description: Fungal infection causing small, circular holes in leaves due to tissue decay, often triggered by high humidity and poor air circulation
precaution: Prune affected leaves, ensure proper spacing, avoid overhead watering, apply fungicides, and maintain garden hygiene

description: Fungal infection causing grayish or brown lesions with dark borders on leaves, leading to wilting, yellowing, and reduced oil yield. Thrives in high humidity and warm temperatures.
precaution: Remove infected leaves, ensure proper spacing for airflow, avoid overhead watering, use balanced fertilizers, apply neem oil or Trichoderma-based biopesticides, and use fungicides like Tricyclazole if severe.

description: Leaf spot in Desmodium is a fungal or bacterial disease that causes small, circular to irregular brown or black spots on the leaves. These spots may enlarge over time, leading to yellowing and premature leaf drop. It can be caused by high humidity, poor air circulation, or infected plant debris
precaution: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, ensure proper spacing, apply fungicides or bactericides if needed, and maintain garden hygiene

description: Fungal or bacterial infection causing small dark or yellowish spots on leaves, which may enlarge, leading to leaf curling, yellowing, and premature drop. Often caused by high humidity and poor air circulation.
precaution: Remove infected leaves, improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering, apply neem oil or Trichoderma-based biopesticides, and use copper-based fungicides or bactericides if severe.

description: Fungal disease caused by Colletotrichum spp., leading to dark, sunken lesions on leaves, fruits, and stems. Infected areas may turn black and spread rapidly, especially in humid conditions.
precaution: Prune infected parts, improve air circulation, apply copper-based fungicides, avoid overhead watering, and ensure proper drainage to reduce humidity.
